hackathon-description-text: Dartmouth College has consistently ranked first in the nation for its quality of undergraduate teaching and student-professor interactions, and at HackDartmouth, we plan to facilitate a similar environment, where hackers collaborate with mentors and each other to create innovative projects.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Head of the Computer Science Department at Dartmouth College
Founder and Managing Director, Borealis Ventures
Director of Developer Programs at Dell
Assistant Professor of Computer Science at Dartmouth College

hackathon-eligibility: Only college students are eligible to hack. You can create a hack with teams up to four people.
hackathon-rules: All hacks must be safe and respectful. Any hacks that do not honor the respect the Dartmouth community upholds will not be judged for prizes upon submission.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: $1000 cash and Samsung Galaxy S Tablets
$800 Cash and Dell Venue 8 Pro Tablets
Asus Vivo Tablets for each team member
Pebble Steel for each team member
$1000 cash prize and Finalist entry to the KPCB Fellows Challenge
Best hack with a health-related application. Fitbit Flex for each team member
Best hack that can benefit the Dartmouth community.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Dartmouth Hack (for Dartmouth students only)

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Thayer School of Engineering at Dartmouth, 14 Engineering Drive, Hanover, NH 03755, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How creative and engaging is the design of their hack?
How easy to use and understandable is their hack?
How creative is their hack? Have you seen many ideas like this before or is this very unique?
Is their hack going to impact peoples lives positively? Are they helping a particular community?
Is their hack tech-savy? Have they shown their skills well and shown how to effectively use technology to being an idea to life?

hackathon-location-address: Thayer School of Engineering at Dartmouth, 14 Engineering Drive, Hanover, NH 03755, USA
hackathon-description-header: HackDartmouth is Dartmouth College’s first ever national hackathon. We’re bringing together 200 students from around the country to work together for 24 hours to build awesome projects.
